name: Ghamidi Center of Islamic Learning
mission: The sole purpose of our existence is to educate people about moral, ethical, and human values as taught in Islam. We aim to separate history and culture from religion and teach it in its purest form as a field of study rather than as a creed. Our teaching method uses common sense, argument, and logic, and we highly value critical thinking over the blind following.
theoryOfChange: By teaching Islam as a field of study based on reason and the Quran/Sunnah (Tazkiyah al-Nafs), the organization aims to purify individual and collective human life from defilements and cultural accretions.
zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://ghamidicenter.com/donate (Source: https://ghamidicenter.com/donate)

dimension_explanations.alignment: AL-Mawrid shows medium alignment with donor expectations by offering clear zakat-eligible giving options and addressing global education needs [2][4]. However, there is room to improve the perceived urgency and specific fit for diverse donor segments [1].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates high financial efficiency with a 75.2% program expense ratio and maintains a Charity Navigator score of 84.5/100 [1][3]. While its capacity-building efforts through programs like AskGhamidi are clear, the direct cost per beneficiary remains a factor in its moderate impact rating [1].

baseline_narrative.headline: AL-Mawrid United States Inc promotes a rational and objective approach to Islamic education through scholarly discourse and global outreach.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 75.2%, ensuring the majority of funds support core educational initiatives
Strong fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.11 per $1 raised
Robust liquidity with 10.9 months of working capital available
baseline_narrative.summary: AL-Mawrid United States Inc is a non-profit organization dedicated to teaching Islamic principles based on reason and rationality through its Education Program and translation services [1][3]. The organization is recognized as zakat-eligible, allowing donors to contribute toward its mission of fostering objective religious understanding [2][4].

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who value intellectual Islamic discourse and want to support the dissemination of Javed Ghamidi's rationalist scholarly work.

Prefer funding scholarly translation and global outreach
Seek to fulfill zakat through educational capacity building
Value high transparency and platinum-level disclosure
giving_considerations: The organization is a small-to-mid-sized niche scholarly institute
Focus is on religious thought rather than direct humanitarian aid
Revenue has remained stable but hasn't shown significant growth
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking immediate humanitarian relief or those who prefer large, multi-service community centers.

impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: The charity aims to create an environment where religious thought can evolve through research and education, specifically by teaching Islam as a foundation for reason.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that scholarly translations and classes are effectively reaching and educating the target audience.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With <cite id="3">flat revenue growth of -0.1%</cite>, the organization has capacity to absorb new funds to expand its translation and digital reach.

strengths.detail: The organization directs <cite id="3">75.2% of its total expenses toward core educational programs</cite>, exceeding the industry standard for efficiency.
The charity maintains <cite id="1">10.9 months of working capital</cite>, providing significant operational resilience against funding fluctuations.
Operations are highly efficient, costing only <cite id="1">$0.11 to raise every $1 in contributions</cite>.

strengths_deep_dive: AL-Mawrid US demonstrates exceptional financial discipline for its size. By maintaining a <cite id="3">fundraising efficiency of $0.11 per $1 raised</cite>, it ensures that the vast majority of donor contributions reach the intended educational outcomes. Furthermore, the organization has achieved the <cite id="4">Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite>, the highest level of recognition for non-profit disclosure. This transparency is backed by <cite id="1">100% independent board members</cite>, ensuring that governance is free from internal conflicts of interest.
rich_narrative.summary: AL-Mawrid United States Inc, operating as the Ghamidi Center of Islamic Learning, is a scholarly institution <cite id="1">founded in 2014</cite> that promotes a rationalist approach to Islamic education. The organization focuses on <cite id="2">exploring and discussing Islam based on reason and objective thinking</cite>, primarily through the work of Javed Ahmed Ghamidi. With <cite id="3">$816,038 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 tax year, the charity maintains a lean operation where <cite id="3">75.2% of expenses are dedicated to program services</cite>. These programs include <cite id="4">educational classes, Sunday schools, and scholar appointments</cite>, alongside extensive translation services to make scholarly religious discourse accessible to a global audience. The organization holds an <cite id="1">overall score of 84.84.5/100 from Charity Navigator</cite>, reflecting a strong commitment to transparency and financial health. As a <cite id="2">zakat-eligible entity</cite>, it provides a specialized avenue for Muslim donors to support intellectual and educational capacity building within the Ummah.
